==Danish== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|da|gjærne}} {{qual|obsolete}} * {{l|da|gærne}} {{qual|obsolete}} * {{l|da|gjerne}} {{qual|obsolete}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|da|non|gjarna|gjarna, gerna}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|da|/ɡer.nə/|[ˈɡæɐ̯nə]}} ===Adverb=== {{head|da|adverb|comparative|hellere|superlative|helst}} # [[with]] [[pleasure]]; [[gladly]], [[willingly]], [[readily]] ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈɡɛrnə/|[ˈɡɛʁnə]|[ˈɡɛɐ̯nə]}} * {{audio|de|De-at-gerne.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-gerne.ogg|Audio}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # {{alternative form of|de|gern}}. {{qualifier|Both are roughly equally frequent.}} [[Category:German phrasebook]] ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|*gerno}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*gernô}}. ===Adverb=== {{dum-adv}} # with [[pleasure]], [[gladly]], [[willingly]] # [[usually]], [[often]] ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nl|gaarne}} * {{desc|li|gaern}}, {{l|li|gaer}} * {{desc|vls|geirn}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID88603|gherne}} * {{R:MNW|12519}}
